intro: Acianthus corniculatus, commonly known as the horned violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, and it produces small, round seed pods that split open when mature. Acianthus corniculatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
